heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain rate registered stands at 27.0mm per hour on 02 September 2025, highlighting an extreme precipitation event.  21.19mm fell during the storm over 15.0 hours.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

nearest_lightning.status: The record of the closest lightning strike stands at 4.97 miles on 13 May 2025.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 15 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 5th since our records started in 23 September 2024.  There have been 9 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 09 September 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no cold snap in progress.  So far, 6 cold snaps have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature difference recorded was 26.7°C on 29 April 2025.  On that date the temperature reached 27.1°C and fell to 0.4°C.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The previous tropical night was on 18 July 2025, with only 62 in total since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (197°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: To date, the maximum wind run recorded is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: To date, the maximum wind speed recorded is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%) and rainfall (up 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 653 m) and light levels (up 6040 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1137 m), light levels (up 7199 lux), and feels like temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 653.1m lower than yesterday, 606.0m lower than the past week, 1137.2m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 850m and a peak of 2900m, averaging 893.6m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and little or no wind. Possible light showers, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and bright intervals likely. Little change in the weather.
